com.stremebase.dal

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stremebase.dal.Table

  • public class Table
extends Object
    Table is container for all fields that share common key (belong to the same database entity).

    First field added acts as a primary field, which is linearly scanned for keys in unindexed queries

    Author:
    olli

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(int id,
             String name)
        Creates a table using the default db
        Parameters:
        id - must be unique for every table (start from zero)
        name - name of the table, used mainly internally

      • Table

        public Table(DB db,
             int id,
             String name)
        Creates a table using another db. Using multiple stremebases makes sense, if you want distribute data to multiple hard drives and operate them in parallel
        Parameters:
        db - the db
        id - the id
        name - the name

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultDb

        public static void setDefaultDb(DB db)
        Normally the first thing to do in an application after db is created
        Parameters:
        db - The db that is used by default

        public void flush()

      • query

        public Cursor query(LongStream fromStream,
                    Collection<LongPredicate> filters,
                    SortOrder sortOrder,
                    int limit)
        Generates a search result cursor
        Parameters:
        fromStream - Stream to filter. If there's no index to use, setting this to null will linearly scan the primary field keys
        filters - the filters
        sortOrder - the sort criteria
        limit - maximum size for the search result, -1 and Integer.MAX_VALUE denote unlimited
        Returns:
        new cursor

      • count

        public long count()
        Number of keys in this table (= in primary field). Relatively slow operation, use sparingly.
        Returns:
        the number

      • keyExists

        public boolean keyExists(long key)
        If the key already exists
        Parameters:
        key - the key
        Returns:
        whether there is data associated with the key in primary field

      • remove

        public void remove(long key)
        Removes the key from all fields and all relations
        Parameters:
        key - the key
